description: A local bakery owner asks SEOAuditPro to check mobile‑friendliness and Google My Business schema; the assistant crawls the site, runs on‑page SEO checks, analyses structured data, and returns a prioritized markdown audit report with actionable local‑SEO recommendations.

messages.content: You are SEOAuditPro, an AI‑powered SEO auditor. Use the provided tools to crawl websites, run on‑page SEO checks, fetch backlink data, and generate a markdown audit report. Explain each step to the user and present the final report in a clear, actionable format.

Hi, I own Sweet Cake Lane, a local bakery at https://sweetcakelane.com. I want to make sure my site is mobile‑friendly and that I have the correct Google My Business (local business) schema in place. Can you audit the site and give me recommendations?

Absolutely! I’ll start by crawling your website to collect the pages, then run a full on‑page SEO analysis (including mobile‑friendliness and structured‑data checks). After that I’ll compile everything into a concise markdown report.

Fetching the site now…

[{"url":"https://sweetcakelane.com/","html":"Sweet Cake Lane - Home

Welcome to Sweet Cake Lane

Our bakery offers ...

"},{"url":"https://sweetcakelane.com/menu","html":"Menu - Sweet Cake Lane

Our Menu

..."}]

Thanks for waiting. I’ve retrieved the homepage and the menu page. Next, I’ll run the on‑page SEO checks (title tags, meta descriptions, heading hierarchy, image alt text, mobile‑friendliness, and schema validation).

Great, the on‑page analysis is done. I’ll now compile the findings, include a brief backlink overview (even though it’s less critical for a local bakery), and generate the final markdown audit report.
Backlink data retrieved. Generating the markdown report now.

guideline_violations.detail: Missing viewport meta tag on both pages

messages.content:
# SEO Audit Report – Sweet Cake Lane **Site:** https://sweetcakelane.com **Date:** 2025-12-08 --- ## Executive Summary Your website is well‑structured and contains relevant content, but there are a few critical issues that prevent optimal performance in mobile search and local‑business rich results. Addressing these will improve visibility in Google’s local pack and on mobile devices. --- ## 1. On‑Page Issues ### a) Mobile‑Friendliness (Priority 1) - **Problem:** Both the Home and Menu pages lack a viewport meta tag, causing poor rendering on smartphones. - **Recommendation:** Add the following inside the `` of every page: ```html ``` - **Impact:** Fixes Mobile‑First indexing issues and improves Core Web Vitals scores. ### b) Structured Data – Bakery Schema (Priority 2) - **Problem:** The Bakery schema on the Home page is missing the `openingHours` property. - **Recommendation:** Include opening hours in ISO‑8601 format, e.g.: ```json "openingHours": "Mo-Fr 07:00-18:00, Sa 08:00-14:00" ``` - **Impact:** Enables Rich Snippets in local search and Google Maps. ### c) Heading Hierarchy (Priority 3) - **Problem:** Only one H1 tag on the Home page; no H2/H3 to structure content. - **Recommendation:** Add logical sub‑headings (e.g., `

Our Best‑Selling Cakes

`). Improves readability and SEO. ### d) Minor Items (Priority 4) - All pages have proper title tags and meta descriptions. - All images include descriptive `alt` attributes. - Menu page schema validates correctly. --- ## 2. Backlink Profile | Source URL | Domain Authority | Anchor Text | |------------|------------------|-------------| | https://localfoodblog.com/review-sweet-cake-lane | 45 | Sweet Cake Lane review | | https://citytourism.org/best-bakeries | 55 | Sweet Cake Lane | **Insight:** You have a modest but high‑quality backlink base from local food and tourism sites—great for local SEO. Consider reaching out for guest posts on additional local blogs to broaden the profile. --- ## 3. Action Plan (30‑Day Sprint) | Day | Task | Owner | |-----|------|-------| | 1‑2 | Add viewport meta tag to all templates | Web developer | | 3‑5 | Extend Bakery schema with `openingHours` and `priceRange` | SEO specialist | | 6‑10 | Refine heading hierarchy on Home and key landing pages | Content editor | | 11‑15 | Audit internal linking to ensure each page is reachable within 2 clicks | SEO specialist | | 16‑20 | Submit updated pages to Google Search Console for re‑indexing | Web developer | | 21‑30 | Outreach to 5 local blogs for backlink opportunities | Marketing lead | --- ## 4. Next Steps 1. Implement the technical fixes above. 2. Run a Mobile‑Friendly Test (Google) after deployment. 3. Request a re‑crawl in Google Search Console. 4. Monitor local pack rankings over the next 4‑6 weeks. Feel free to ask any follow‑up questions or request a deeper dive into any section of this report!

The audit report is ready (see above). The most urgent items are adding the viewport meta tag and completing the Bakery schema with opening hours. Once those are fixed, you should see improved mobile rankings and may qualify for rich local results in Google Search. Let me know if you’d like step‑by‑step code snippets, help updating your CMS, or assistance with the local outreach plan.
